Is your cup half full or empty?
When we talk, you say it softly
But I love it when you're awfully...
body:
Wake up and smell the coffee

Is your cup half full or empty?

When we talk, you say it softly

But I love it when you’re awfully quiet ☕️

You see the piece of paper

Could be a little greater

Show me what you could make her

You’ll never know until you try it

And you don’t have to keep it quiet

title: Passive Aggressive
body:
Part: five

A one shot turned minific where Harry’s a bit of an asshole and all Jasmine really wants is for him to show her his world.

read part four here // send me your thoughts here!

The first thing Harry notices is that she’s cut her hair. The second thing he notices is that she’s standing across from a guy with her cheeks pink and smile bright. He stands there for a few minutes, heart in his throat as he stares at the girl whose heart he’d broken, only to break his own with her.

She looks happy he notes, watching as she throws her head back and laughs openly at something the man said. He grins at her reaction, a smug smile settling on his lips as he watches her. Harry feels his stomach churn at the interaction. He can’t remember the last time Jazz had laughed like that around him.

He wonders if she’ll ever laugh like that around him again because no matter what happened or how much time passed, Harry still wasn’t able to accept that Jazz was gone for good.

Ever since Zayn had reminded him of her art show Harry had been restless. He’d found a new found purpose, a lead on how to see - and hopefully win back - Jazz again. And he wasn’t going to let some guy stand in his way.

He was hurt, there was no denying it. He hadn’t thought Jazz would be able to move on from him so quickly - or maybe he’d hoped she wouldn’t be able to. He doesn’t know if that makes him a bad person or not (he already knew he was a bad boyfriend), but he thinks it probably does.

And he’s angry too, he finds. Underneath all the hurt and guilt, Harry feels a bubbling anger - at himself, at the guy who now had his hand resting gently on Jazz’s arm, at Jazz. She’d promised him she’d never leave him, hadn’t she? That she’d never give up on them; on him. But there she was, laughing and smiling at a man that wasn’t him while Harry felt himself drift further and further away.

He loves her so much. Can’t imagine his world without her. He wonders when things changed between them, when he’d taken her presence for granted and started ignoring the way she’d always made his day better even when they fought and argued. Jazz had always had a rule - no matter how mad they were at each other, no matter what they were doing or where they were, they always said I love you at least once a day.

With a jolt he realises he can’t remember the last time he’d said those words to her, can’t even remember the last time he’s said anything remotely affectionate to her.

He pulls out his phone and opens up his messages immediately searching for Jazz’s name. He finds her almost instantly, she was always at the top of his recent contacts, and feels what’s left of his heart squeeze in on itself.

There were messages after messages that he’d ignored from her, scattered ‘I love you’s and ‘where are you’s that he had paid no mind to. The questions and worried messages and missed calls had eventually tapered out, but the ‘I love you’s continued to come through all the way until the night he’d last seen her.

Harry has tried to text and call her multiple times since then but either she’s blocked his number (which he can’t blame her for), or she’s ignoring him the same way he’d ignored her (which he can’t blame her for either).

He rubs a tired hand over his face and chews on his lower lip. His fingers twitch and he clenches his hand into a fist beside his side. He wants to call her, wants to see if she really is screening all his calls. But he doesn’t think he can stomach seeing her actively ignore him.

The man standing in front of her is making her smile again and Harry envisions - just for a second - what their life might be like together. He tries to stop the thought before it can fully form but it’s too late and he’s seeing white fences and a dog in the yard and children with Jazz’s smile and blonde hair like her companions; and it all looks wrong.

The house is meant to be on hill in the countryside overlooking a huge garden with a shed at the back filled with art supplies and more than one puppy running around. The kids are meant to have curly brown hair and green eyes that glint in the sun as they run around screaming and giggling while their dad chases them. There are cats lounging on the porch while Jazz strokes them, a fond smile tugging on her lips as she watches her family plant flowers and herbs.

Harry shakes himself out of his thoughts and before he knows it, he’s making his way over to the woman who holds his future in his hands. He wasn’t sure he’d ever be able to move on from her, not when he’s planned their whole future together. He’d even gone looking for a damn ring last year, ready to ask her to marry him. And then he’d gone and fucked it all up instead.

The man she’d been standing with is gone Harry notes and he feels a sense of relief that he hadn’t seen them part ways. He wasn’t sure what he would have done if he’d seen him kiss his girl goodbye.

“Jasmine,” he chokes out once he’s close enough, once he’s walked through the door and the bell above his head chimes his arrival, once she turns around and sees him standing there her eyes wide and posture stiff.

Harry waits and waits for her to say something, anything, but all Jazz does is stand there and stare at him and Harry imagines she’s drinking him in the way he is doing to her. Her cheeks are flushed pink and Harry can’t help but wonder if the man from before put them there. His gut churns.

He swallows roughly and it feels as though there’s a stone lodged deep in his oesophagus keeping him from speaking.

He wants to tell her he loves her, he wants to tell her he’s sorry, he wants to beg her to come home.

But instead, he just stands there staring. A broken man with a broken heart and the only girl he thinks can ever make him whole again standing in front of him chewing her bottom lip raw.

Harry takes in the sight of her full pink lip disappearing between her teeth and finally finds he can’t stay away from her any longer. He practically lunges towards her too quickly and too slowly all at the same time. He doesn’t want to spook her but staying away from her for even another second is too much. What if she disappears again?

“Jazz,” he whispers when he’s close enough, watching the way her lashes flutter shut and the breath stutters out of her, like she’d been holding her breath and hadn’t even realised it. Harry studies her closely, fingers twitching as he notes the darkness under her eyes. “You look tired,” he says his eyes cataloguing every little change he sees in her.

“Harry.”

His name whispered on her lips is worse than a punch to the gut and he feels like he won’t ever be able to breathe again unless he hears it again and again and again for the rest of his life.

“What are you doing here?”

He’d forgotten how sweet she sounded, how her laugh used to echo around their flat when everything was too quiet and tense and he needed something to calm him down.

He reaches out to her this time, his palm resting on her cheek as he strokes along under her eyes. “I miss you.”

She leans into him, her eyes fluttering shut as her breath puffs out across his wrist.

He stands still, unwilling to move away but worried that she’ll push him off if he tries to bring her closer. Instead he takes in a deep breath, trying to breathe her in, in, in.

She smells like watermelons and he wonders if she tastes the same, his eyes sinking to her lips and the way they shone in the glow of the studio lights. He knows she’s prone to overusing her lip balm when she’s stressed, swiping it across her lips almost every half an hour. He’s seen her go through more than one tube a week and fallen into the habit of always having a few sitting spare at home.

“Did Zayn tell you I was here?” she asks him, and Harry is finally able to look away from her lips. He can’t help but note that she’s avoided responding to his confession and as hurt as he is, he knows that he can’t blame her for it.

“I had to force it out of him,” he nods at her. They’re still standing inches from each other and she still hasn’t pushed him away and Harry is taking that as a good sign.

“I doubt it would have taken much prodding.” She winces as the words come out a little sharper than she’d intended. “He’s never been very good at keeping secrets,” she adds.

“Especially when he thinks he’s right,” Harry joins in.

It’s awkward.

Neither of them know what to say and neither of them seem to be willing to pull away.

Harry’s still trying to take all of her in, trying to note any changes in the month they had spent apart. She’s thinner and looks more tired and nervous and her eyes don’t shine the way he’s always used to, but she still looks like Jazz and he still thinks she’s perfect.

Jazz can’t help taking him in either. She looks at him and sees her past and future all entwined together and she doesn’t know how to pull them apart.

She wants to be strong, wants to push him away and tell him that no, she doesn’t care that he misses her, that he should have remembered that before he had treated her so mean.

But she can’t.

She can’t because despite what he’s done, he’s still standing in front of her with his eyes once again honest and kind and all kinds of hurt and she wonders if maybe he sees the same in hers.

Zayn’s been telling her she needs to come home through texts she never answers, to forgive him at least a little bit because he’s not been doing very well. She hadn’t wanted to believe him at first, and she’d hated herself for hoping it was true for the longest time afterwards as well. Now as she looks up at him as he tells her he misses her, she sees that it was true and she doesn’t feel the satisfaction she thought she would have at the idea she wasn’t the only one suffering. She just feels sad.

She doesn’t know how they ended up here, two pieces of a broken puzzle that have no right fitting together anymore. But they do. They always will, she thinks.

“Why are you here, Harry?” she asks eventually, finally shifting away from him.

They both feel the loss instantly, a sudden chill running down both their spines.

Harry tucks his hands deep into his pockets, digging into the skin of his thighs to keep from reaching out for her again.

“I want you to come home,” he tells her without hesitation. He thinks it should be more said more eloquently as soon as the words are past his lips but it’s too late and as blunt as they may be, he’s spoken the truth. He just hopes that Jazz can see that.

He panics when he sees her look away from him. When she bites her lips and looks over his shoulder and out the door. He wonders if she’s thinking about the man who was in here before him and he feels the panic rise to his throat like bile as he imagines her with someone else.

“Please?” he forces out. “I love you.” And as he looks at her and sees the way her eyes widen a little and her shoulders drop at those words, he realises just how long it has been since he’s said them to her. So he repeats them and silently vows to himself to say them every chance he gets for as long as she’ll have him. Even if it is just for the next few minutes before she tells him she’s met someone else. “I love you.” He says again, firmer. “So please, come home.”

“I – I dunno if I can,” she confesses and she still won’t look at him and Harry feels like he can’t breathe. “There’s this space between us and I don’t know how to close it. I don’t know if we can.” She doesn’t really mean it when she says that, doesn’t want it to be true either. But she’s started to doubt their relationship, she’s started to doubt Harry and she thinks a part of her still wants to hurt him for that.

“Of course you can,” Harry says urgently, taking a step closer to her. She was too far away. Always too far. “You and me Jazz, we belong together, we always will. Together we can take over the whole damn world if we wanted to.”

And she believes him. She believes him because he’s Harry and she knows that a part of her – most of her – will always love him.

“Remember?” he steps closer to her, eyes flicking all over her face as he tries to read her. He hates that he’s finding it so difficult now. He’s never found it so difficult before. “You said you’d never give up on us.” And he knows he sounds accusatory, that she had every right to leave him. But he’s still hurt and he’s still in love with her and if he doesn’t tell her everything now he knows he’ll never forgive himself.

Jazz looks at him then, meets his gaze straight on and Harry’s finally able to read her again but he wishes he wasn’t, because when she looks at him now she looks nervous and afraid and unsure. Something she’s not been with him since she’d first introduced him to her family.

“Don’t. Don’t look at me like that please. Don’t look at me like it’s the first time we’ve met all over again.”

Jazz doesn’t say anything and he steels himself to having his heart broken. But when it doesn’t come and she continues to look at him still, he promises himself that he’ll do anything he can to make sure she never looks at him like that again.

Jazz sees the moment the resolve sets in his eyes like a curtain opening up to let the sun in and she thinks back to when they first met, when she’d told her family about him. She thinks about how her parents had been worried that she wouldn’t be able to handle being in a relationship with someone who was constantly in the spotlight and she remembers telling Harry as much.

He’d taken her face between his hands and kissed every inch of worry away with his lips and then promised that he’d change their mind. He’d had the same look in his eyes then that he does now and she knows without a doubt that he would’ve spent the rest of his life trying to make sure he kept his promise.

But he hadn’t needed to.

Her parents had loved him almost as much as she did, and even when she’d gone to them after the fight she’d had with Harry a month ago, they’d still urged her to go back and talk it through with him. ‘That boy would burn himself to the ground trying to bring you the sun if you asked him to’ her mum had told her.

“Jazz?” he calls out to her, and when she blinks she realises he’s looking at her worriedly. “Are you ok? Your eyes glazed over a little there. Have you been drinking enough water? Are you feeling ok?” His hands flutter by his sides before he gives in and reaches out to feel her head for a temperature.

He looks so worried about her that she can’t help it. She leans up and kisses him.

Harry’s entire body goes slack at the contact and wonders how he’s managed to be apart from her for so long without falling completely to pieces. When she pulls away from him, it’s too soon and he feels himself starting to unravel again but he just barely holds himself together. There were more important things to worry about right now.

“Does this mean you’ll come home?” he asks her, breathes on her, really. He hasn’t moved away and neither has she and their lips have barely separated from one another. He can feel whispers of her kiss with every word he utters as his lips skim along hers and their breath mingles together. With her so close, he feels as though he’s got a part of himself back.

“Yes,” she nods and Harry swears she moves even closer and his heart swells. “I’ve been miserable without you,” she confesses, whispers it across his lips like a secret only meant for him and he kisses her again. Harder, deeper and infinitely more desperate. There’s over a month of kisses he has to make up for.

A flash of blonde hair and Jazz laughing crosses his mind and he thinks of the man who was in here earlier, his hands on her arms and a fond smile on his lips and he wonders if maybe someone else had already been kissing her while he was waiting for her to come home.

He pulls away from her and instantly regrets it when Jazz tries to chase his lips. But his stomach has dropped and his mood has plummeted and he wonders if maybe they had been broken up this past month and not just giving each other space.

“I – that man,” he scratches at the back of his neck roughly. He doesn’t know what to say. How to say it. So he just speaks without thinking about the words flowing past his lips. “There was a man in here earlier,” he starts. “Who was he?” he thinks he sounds a little angry but he can’t help it. He’s nervous and jealous and the idea of another man putting his hands on his Jasmine makes Harry see red.

He wasn’t normally a jealous person. But Jazz was his.

“Man?” Jazz tilts her head, tries to move closer to him once more and looks hurt when he steps back again. “What man?”

Harry feels angry suddenly. He’d seen them standing together, much like he and Jazz were right now. Was she trying to lie to him? Did she think he’d leave her if he found out she’d moved on so quickly? Fat chance. Harry narrowed his eyes at the thought. He’d fight tooth and nail for her. take on the whole damn world and turn it to ashes to win her back.

“There was a man in here earlier, Jazz. I saw him standing exactly the way we are right now.”

“Oh!” she grins when she realises who he’s talking about. Body slumping with relief. “You mean Matt.”

Harry already hates him. Hates the way she smiles when she says his name. Hates that she ever said it in the first place. “I guess so. The one who was touching you too much.”

“Touching me?” she blinks at him and the confusion is back.

“Yes,” Harry nods vigorously. “He had his hand on your arm and you were laughing at something he’d said. If he’s a client it wasn’t very professional,” he adds, he sounds pouty and superior all at once and Jazz wants to hug him and kiss him and hit him all at once.

But then she realises what he’s saying and suddenly Jazz is laughing at him and Harry’s torn between watching her with awe and pulling his hair out because this was serious.

“Harry, are you jealous?” she asks him, once her laughter had turned to giggles and she once again took a step closer to him. This time he stays where he is.

“No.” Yes.

“No?” she quirks a brow. “So if I were to tell you I have plans this weekend to grab dinner with Matt, you’d be ok with that?”

Harry couldn’t stop the growl that escaped his lips if he tried and he doesn’t think he wants to. The very idea of Jazz with someone else has him seeing red and all he wants to do is grab hold of her and lock her away in a tower like Rapunzel with only each other for company. He really likes the idea of that.

“Fine, I’m a little jealous,” he admits, reaching out and entwining their hands together. “I don’t like the idea of you with someone else. But… I – I don’t blame you if you’ve found someone who treated you the way you deserved.” He forces the words past his lips and even tries to mean them but his heart still clenches at the thought and he thinks that it may very well stop if she agrees.

“Matt’s my cousin, you silly goose,” she bumps his shoulder fondly. “He’s in the city for the weekend and wanted to grab dinner before he left.”

“Oh.” Harry grins down at her sheepishly. “Can I come?”

Jazz lets out a loud, happy laugh and pulls him towards the door. “Come on, Harry, let’s go home.”

“I might never let you leave,” he warns her only half jokingly.

“I’ll hold you to that,” she warns him, her heart full once again. Harry pulls her to him and plants a kiss wherever his lips land and continues to do so every couple of steps on the way home – her lips, her hair, her nose, her cheeks – every inch of her face was covered in soft kisses and every kiss was followed by an ‘I love you’.

They don’t notice the flashes as pictures are taken and fans whisper about why the couple looks so happy together. And when Jazz shows him an article that Zayn had linked her with a series of question marks and a confused congratulations – the headline read that they were engaged – Harry laughs along with Jazz. He ignores the emails and phone calls his agent sends him about putting out a statement (there’s no point denying it when he’s already started ring shopping) and continues to spend the rest of the week couped up inside his flat with his girlfriend, mentally planning their future together.

AN: AND DAS THE END MY PEEPS. Sorry it took so long (I really have no excuse sorry). Anyway, I may post some drabbles/blurbs etc if you guys want. So send me some requests and I’ll try and write them if I feel inspireddddd. Also, let me know what you think!!! Byeeeee

She leans into him, her eyes fluttering shut as her breath puffs out across his wrist.

He stands still, unwilling to move away but worried that she’ll push him off if he tries to bring her closer. Instead he takes in a deep breath, trying to breathe her in, in, in.

She smells like watermelons and he wonders if she tastes the same, his eyes sinking to her lips and the way they shone in the glow of the studio lights. He knows she’s prone to overusing her lip balm when she’s stressed, swiping it across her lips almost every half an hour. He’s seen her go through more than one tube a week and fallen into the habit of always having a few sitting spare at home.

“Did Zayn tell you I was here?” she asks him, and Harry is finally able to look away from her lips. He can’t help but note that she’s avoided responding to his confession and as hurt as he is, he knows that he can’t blame her for it.

“I had to force it out of him,” he nods at her. They’re still standing inches from each other and she still hasn’t pushed him away and Harry is taking that as a good sign.

“I doubt it would have taken much prodding.” She winces as the words come out a little sharper than she’d intended. “He’s never been very good at keeping secrets,” she adds.

“Especially when he thinks he’s right,” Harry joins in.

It’s awkward.

Neither of them know what to say and neither of them seem to be willing to pull away.

Harry’s still trying to take all of her in, trying to note any changes in the month they had spent apart. She’s thinner and looks more tired and nervous and her eyes don’t shine the way he’s always used to, but she still looks like Jazz and he still thinks she’s perfect.

Jazz can’t help taking him in either. She looks at him and sees her past and future all entwined together and she doesn’t know how to pull them apart.

She wants to be strong, wants to push him away and tell him that no, she doesn’t care that he misses her, that he should have remembered that before he had treated her so mean.

But she can’t.

She can’t because despite what he’s done, he’s still standing in front of her with his eyes once again honest and kind and all kinds of hurt and she wonders if maybe he sees the same in hers.

Zayn’s been telling her she needs to come home through texts she never answers, to forgive him at least a little bit because he’s not been doing very well. She hadn’t wanted to believe him at first, and she’d hated herself for hoping it was true for the longest time afterwards as well. Now as she looks up at him as he tells her he misses her, she sees that it was true and she doesn’t feel the satisfaction she thought she would have at the idea she wasn’t the only one suffering. She just feels sad.

She doesn’t know how they ended up here, two pieces of a broken puzzle that have no right fitting together anymore. But they do. They always will, she thinks.

“Why are you here, Harry?” she asks eventually, finally shifting away from him.

They both feel the loss instantly, a sudden chill running down both their spines.

Harry tucks his hands deep into his pockets, digging into the skin of his thighs to keep from reaching out for her again.

“I want you to come home,” he tells her without hesitation. He thinks it should be more said more eloquently as soon as the words are past his lips but it’s too late and as blunt as they may be, he’s spoken the truth. He just hopes that Jazz can see that.

He panics when he sees her look away from him. When she bites her lips and looks over his shoulder and out the door. He wonders if she’s thinking about the man who was in here before him and he feels the panic rise to his throat like bile as he imagines her with someone else.

“Please?” he forces out. “I love you.” And as he looks at her and sees the way her eyes widen a little and her shoulders drop at those words, he realises just how long it has been since he’s said them to her. So he repeats them and silently vows to himself to say them every chance he gets for as long as she’ll have him. Even if it is just for the next few minutes before she tells him she’s met someone else. “I love you.” He says again, firmer. “So please, come home.”

“I – I dunno if I can,” she confesses and she still won’t look at him and Harry feels like he can’t breathe. “There’s this space between us and I don’t know how to close it. I don’t know if we can.” She doesn’t really mean it when she says that, doesn’t want it to be true either. But she’s started to doubt their relationship, she’s started to doubt Harry and she thinks a part of her still wants to hurt him for that.

“Of course you can,” Harry says urgently, taking a step closer to her. She was too far away. Always too far. “You and me Jazz, we belong together, we always will. Together we can take over the whole damn world if we wanted to.”

And she believes him. She believes him because he’s Harry and she knows that a part of her – most of her – will always love him.

“Remember?” he steps closer to her, eyes flicking all over her face as he tries to read her. He hates that he’s finding it so difficult now. He’s never found it so difficult before. “You said you’d never give up on us.” And he knows he sounds accusatory, that she had every right to leave him. But he’s still hurt and he’s still in love with her and if he doesn’t tell her everything now he knows he’ll never forgive himself.

Jazz looks at him then, meets his gaze straight on and Harry’s finally able to read her again but he wishes he wasn’t, because when she looks at him now she looks nervous and afraid and unsure. Something she’s not been with him since she’d first introduced him to her family.

“Don’t. Don’t look at me like that please. Don’t look at me like it’s the first time we’ve met all over again.”

Jazz doesn’t say anything and he steels himself to having his heart broken. But when it doesn’t come and she continues to look at him still, he promises himself that he’ll do anything he can to make sure she never looks at him like that again.

Jazz sees the moment the resolve sets in his eyes like a curtain opening up to let the sun in and she thinks back to when they first met, when she’d told her family about him. She thinks about how her parents had been worried that she wouldn’t be able to handle being in a relationship with someone who was constantly in the spotlight and she remembers telling Harry as much.

He’d taken her face between his hands and kissed every inch of worry away with his lips and then promised that he’d change their mind. He’d had the same look in his eyes then that he does now and she knows without a doubt that he would’ve spent the rest of his life trying to make sure he kept his promise.

But he hadn’t needed to.

Her parents had loved him almost as much as she did, and even when she’d gone to them after the fight she’d had with Harry a month ago, they’d still urged her to go back and talk it through with him. ‘That boy would burn himself to the ground trying to bring you the sun if you asked him to’ her mum had told her.

“Jazz?” he calls out to her, and when she blinks she realises he’s looking at her worriedly. “Are you ok? Your eyes glazed over a little there. Have you been drinking enough water? Are you feeling ok?” His hands flutter by his sides before he gives in and reaches out to feel her head for a temperature.

He looks so worried about her that she can’t help it. She leans up and kisses him.

Harry’s entire body goes slack at the contact and wonders how he’s managed to be apart from her for so long without falling completely to pieces. When she pulls away from him, it’s too soon and he feels himself starting to unravel again but he just barely holds himself together. There were more important things to worry about right now.

“Does this mean you’ll come home?” he asks her, breathes on her, really. He hasn’t moved away and neither has she and their lips have barely separated from one another. He can feel whispers of her kiss with every word he utters as his lips skim along hers and their breath mingles together. With her so close, he feels as though he’s got a part of himself back.

“Yes,” she nods and Harry swears she moves even closer and his heart swells. “I’ve been miserable without you,” she confesses, whispers it across his lips like a secret only meant for him and he kisses her again. Harder, deeper and infinitely more desperate. There’s over a month of kisses he has to make up for.

A flash of blonde hair and Jazz laughing crosses his mind and he thinks of the man who was in here earlier, his hands on her arms and a fond smile on his lips and he wonders if maybe someone else had already been kissing her while he was waiting for her to come home.

He pulls away from her and instantly regrets it when Jazz tries to chase his lips. But his stomach has dropped and his mood has plummeted and he wonders if maybe they had been broken up this past month and not just giving each other space.

“I – that man,” he scratches at the back of his neck roughly. He doesn’t know what to say. How to say it. So he just speaks without thinking about the words flowing past his lips. “There was a man in here earlier,” he starts. “Who was he?” he thinks he sounds a little angry but he can’t help it. He’s nervous and jealous and the idea of another man putting his hands on his Jasmine makes Harry see red.

He wasn’t normally a jealous person. But Jazz was his.

“Man?” Jazz tilts her head, tries to move closer to him once more and looks hurt when he steps back again. “What man?”

Harry feels angry suddenly. He’d seen them standing together, much like he and Jazz were right now. Was she trying to lie to him? Did she think he’d leave her if he found out she’d moved on so quickly? Fat chance. Harry narrowed his eyes at the thought. He’d fight tooth and nail for her. take on the whole damn world and turn it to ashes to win her back.

“There was a man in here earlier, Jazz. I saw him standing exactly the way we are right now.”

“Oh!” she grins when she realises who he’s talking about. Body slumping with relief. “You mean Matt.”

Harry already hates him. Hates the way she smiles when she says his name. Hates that she ever said it in the first place. “I guess so. The one who was touching you too much.”

“Touching me?” she blinks at him and the confusion is back.

“Yes,” Harry nods vigorously. “He had his hand on your arm and you were laughing at something he’d said. If he’s a client it wasn’t very professional,” he adds, he sounds pouty and superior all at once and Jazz wants to hug him and kiss him and hit him all at once.

But then she realises what he’s saying and suddenly Jazz is laughing at him and Harry’s torn between watching her with awe and pulling his hair out because this was serious.

“Harry, are you jealous?” she asks him, once her laughter had turned to giggles and she once again took a step closer to him. This time he stays where he is.

“No.” Yes.

“No?” she quirks a brow. “So if I were to tell you I have plans this weekend to grab dinner with Matt, you’d be ok with that?”

Harry couldn’t stop the growl that escaped his lips if he tried and he doesn’t think he wants to. The very idea of Jazz with someone else has him seeing red and all he wants to do is grab hold of her and lock her away in a tower like Rapunzel with only each other for company. He really likes the idea of that.

“Fine, I’m a little jealous,” he admits, reaching out and entwining their hands together. “I don’t like the idea of you with someone else. But… I – I don’t blame you if you’ve found someone who treated you the way you deserved.” He forces the words past his lips and even tries to mean them but his heart still clenches at the thought and he thinks that it may very well stop if she agrees.

“Matt’s my cousin, you silly goose,” she bumps his shoulder fondly. “He’s in the city for the weekend and wanted to grab dinner before he left.”

“Oh.” Harry grins down at her sheepishly. “Can I come?”

Jazz lets out a loud, happy laugh and pulls him towards the door. “Come on, Harry, let’s go home.”

“I might never let you leave,” he warns her only half jokingly.

“I’ll hold you to that,” she warns him, her heart full once again. Harry pulls her to him and plants a kiss wherever his lips land and continues to do so every couple of steps on the way home – her lips, her hair, her nose, her cheeks – every inch of her face was covered in soft kisses and every kiss was followed by an ‘I love you’.

They don’t notice the flashes as pictures are taken and fans whisper about why the couple looks so happy together. And when Jazz shows him an article that Zayn had linked her with a series of question marks and a confused congratulations – the headline read that they were engaged – Harry laughs along with Jazz. He ignores the emails and phone calls his agent sends him about putting out a statement (there’s no point denying it when he’s already started ring shopping) and continues to spend the rest of the week couped up inside his flat with his girlfriend, mentally planning their future together.

Harry feels his stomach churn at the interaction. He can’t remember the last time Jazz had laughed like that around him.

He wonders if she’ll ever laugh like that around him again because no matter what happened or how much time passed, Harry still wasn’t able to accept that Jazz was gone for good.

Ever since Zayn had reminded him of her art show Harry had been restless. He’d found a new found purpose, a lead on how to see - and hopefully win back - Jazz again. And he wasn’t going to let some guy stand in his way.

He was hurt, there was no denying it. He hadn’t thought Jazz would be able to move on from him so quickly - or maybe he’d hoped she wouldn’t be able to. He doesn’t know if that makes him a bad person or not (he already knew he was a bad boyfriend), but he thinks it probably does.

And he’s angry too, he finds. Underneath all the hurt and guilt, Harry feels a bubbling anger - at himself, at the guy who now had his hand resting gently on Jazz’s arm, at Jazz. She’d promised him she’d never leave him, hadn’t she? That she’d never give up on them; on him. But there she was, laughing and smiling at a man that wasn’t him while Harry felt himself drift further and further away.

He loves her so much. Can’t imagine his world without her. He wonders when things changed between them, when he’d taken her presence for granted and started ignoring the way she’d always made his day better even when they fought and argued. Jazz had always had a rule - no matter how mad they were at each other, no matter what they were doing or where they were, they always said I love you at least once a day.

The questions and worried messages and missed calls had eventually tapered out, but the ‘I love you’s continued to come through all the way until the night he’d last seen her.

The man standing in front of her is making her smile again and Harry envisions - just for a second - what their life might be like together. The house is meant to be on hill in the countryside overlooking a huge garden with a shed at the back filled with art supplies and more than one puppy running around. The kids are meant to have curly brown hair and green eyes that glint in the sun as they run around screaming and giggling while their dad chases them. There are cats lounging on the porch while Jazz strokes them, a fond smile tugging on her lips as she watches her family plant flowers and herbs.

Harry shakes himself out of his thoughts and before he knows it, he’s making his way over to the woman who holds his future in his hands. He really likes the idea of that.

But… I – I don’t blame you if you’ve found someone who treated you the way you deserved.” He forces the words past his lips and even tries to mean them but his heart still clenches at the thought and he thinks that it may very well stop if she agrees.

“Matt’s my cousin, you silly goose,” she bumps his shoulder fondly. “He’s in the city for the weekend and wanted to grab dinner before he left.”

“Oh.” Harry grins down at her sheepishly. “Can I come?”

Jazz lets out a loud, happy laugh and pulls him towards the door. “Come on, Harry, let’s go home.”

“I might never let you leave,” he warns her only half jokingly.

“I’ll hold you to that,” she warns him, her heart full once again. Harry pulls her to him and plants a kiss wherever his lips land and continues to do so every couple of steps on the way home – her lips, her hair, her nose, her cheeks – every inch of her face was covered in soft kisses and every kiss was followed by an ‘I love you’.

They don’t notice the flashes as pictures are taken and fans whisper about why the couple looks so happy together. And when Jazz shows him an article that Zayn had linked her with a series of question marks and a confused congratulations – the headline read that they were engaged – Harry laughs along with Jazz. He ignores the emails and phone calls his agent sends him about putting out a statement (there’s no point denying it when he’s already started ring shopping) and continues to spend the rest of the week couped up inside his flat with his girlfriend, mentally planning their future together.

AN: AND DAS THE END MY PEEPS. Sorry it took so long (I really have no excuse sorry). Anyway, I may post some drabbles/blurbs etc if you guys want. So send me some requests and I’ll try and write them if I feel inspireddddd. Also, let me know what you think!!! Byeeeee
trail.content:
Part: five

A one shot turned minific where Harry’s a bit of an asshole and all Jasmine really wants is for him to show her his world.

read part four here // send me your thoughts here!

The first thing Harry notices is that she’s cut her hair. The second thing he notices is that she’s standing across from a guy with her cheeks pink and smile bright. He stands there for a few minutes, heart in his throat as he stares at the girl whose heart he’d broken, only to break his own with her.

She looks happy he notes, watching as she throws her head back and laughs openly at something the man said. He grins at her reaction, a smug smile settling on his lips as he watches her. Harry feels his stomach churn at the interaction. He can’t remember the last time Jazz had laughed like that around him.

He wonders if she’ll ever laugh like that around him again because no matter what happened or how much time passed, Harry still wasn’t able to accept that Jazz was gone for good.

Ever since Zayn had reminded him of her art show Harry had been restless. He’d found a new found purpose, a lead on how to see - and hopefully win back - Jazz again. And he wasn’t going to let some guy stand in his way.

He was hurt, there was no denying it. He hadn’t thought Jazz would be able to move on from him so quickly - or maybe he’d hoped she wouldn’t be able to. He doesn’t know if that makes him a bad person or not (he already knew he was a bad boyfriend), but he thinks it probably does.

And he’s angry too, he finds. Underneath all the hurt and guilt, Harry feels a bubbling anger - at himself, at the guy who now had his hand resting gently on Jazz’s arm, at Jazz. She’d promised him she’d never leave him, hadn’t she? That she’d never give up on them; on him. But there she was, laughing and smiling at a man that wasn’t him while Harry felt himself drift further and further away.

He loves her so much. Can’t imagine his world without her. He wonders when things changed between them, when he’d taken her presence for granted and started ignoring the way she’d always made his day better even when they fought and argued. Jazz had always had a rule - no matter how mad they were at each other, no matter what they were doing or where they were, they always said I love you at least once a day.

With a jolt he realises he can’t remember the last time he’d said those words to her, can’t even remember the last time he’s said anything remotely affectionate to her.

He pulls out his phone and opens up his messages immediately searching for Jazz’s name. He finds her almost instantly, she was always at the top of his recent contacts, and feels what’s left of his heart squeeze in on itself.

There were messages after messages that he’d ignored from her, scattered ‘I love you’s and ‘where are you’s that he had paid no mind to. The questions and worried messages and missed calls had eventually tapered out, but the ‘I love you’s continued to come through all the way until the night he’d last seen her.

Harry has tried to text and call her multiple times since then but either she’s blocked his number (which he can’t blame her for), or she’s ignoring him the same way he’d ignored her (which he can’t blame her for either).

He rubs a tired hand over his face and chews on his lower lip. His fingers twitch and he clenches his hand into a fist beside his side. He wants to call her, wants to see if she really is screening all his calls. But he doesn’t think he can stomach seeing her actively ignore him.

The man standing in front of her is making her smile again and Harry envisions - just for a second - what their life might be like together. He tries to stop the thought before it can fully form but it’s too late and he’s seeing white fences and a dog in the yard and children with Jazz’s smile and blonde hair like her companions; and it all looks wrong.

The house is meant to be on hill in the countryside overlooking a huge garden with a shed at the back filled with art supplies and more than one puppy running around. The kids are meant to have curly brown hair and green eyes that glint in the sun as they run around screaming and giggling while their dad chases them. There are cats lounging on the porch while Jazz strokes them, a fond smile tugging on her lips as she watches her family plant flowers and herbs.

Harry shakes himself out of his thoughts and before he knows it, he’s making his way over to the woman who holds his future in his hands. He wasn’t sure he’d ever be able to move on from her, not when he’s planned their whole future together. He’d even gone looking for a damn ring last year, ready to ask her to marry him. And then he’d gone and fucked it all up instead.

The man she’d been standing with is gone Harry notes and he feels a sense of relief that he hadn’t seen them part ways. He wasn’t sure what he would have done if he’d seen him kiss his girl goodbye.

“Jasmine,” he chokes out once he’s close enough, once he’s walked through the door and the bell above his head chimes his arrival, once she turns around and sees him standing there her eyes wide and posture stiff.

Harry waits and waits for her to say something, anything, but all Jazz does is stand there and stare at him and Harry imagines she’s drinking him in the way he is doing to her. Her cheeks are flushed pink and Harry can’t help but wonder if the man from before put them there. His gut churns.

He swallows roughly and it feels as though there’s a stone lodged deep in his oesophagus keeping him from speaking.

He wants to tell her he loves her, he wants to tell her he’s sorry, he wants to beg her to come home.

But instead, he just stands there staring. A broken man with a broken heart and the only girl he thinks can ever make him whole again standing in front of him chewing her bottom lip raw.

Harry takes in the sight of her full pink lip disappearing between her teeth and finally finds he can’t stay away from her any longer. He practically lunges towards her too quickly and too slowly all at the same time. He doesn’t want to spook her but staying away from her for even another second is too much. What if she disappears again?

“Jazz,” he whispers when he’s close enough, watching the way her lashes flutter shut and the breath stutters out of her, like she’d been holding her breath and hadn’t even realised it. Harry studies her closely, fingers twitching as he notes the darkness under her eyes. “You look tired,” he says his eyes cataloguing every little change he sees in her.

“Harry.”

His name whispered on her lips is worse than a punch to the gut and he feels like he won’t ever be able to breathe again unless he hears it again and again and again for the rest of his life.

“What are you doing here?”

He’d forgotten how sweet she sounded, how her laugh used to echo around their flat when everything was too quiet and tense and he needed something to calm him down.

He reaches out to her this time, his palm resting on her cheek as he strokes along under her eyes. “I miss you.”

She leans into him, her eyes fluttering shut as her breath puffs out across his wrist.

He stands still, unwilling to move away but worried that she’ll push him off if he tries to bring her closer. Instead he takes in a deep breath, trying to breathe her in, in, in.

She smells like watermelons and he wonders if she tastes the same, his eyes sinking to her lips and the way they shone in the glow of the studio lights. He knows she’s prone to overusing her lip balm when she’s stressed, swiping it across her lips almost every half an hour. He’s seen her go through more than one tube a week and fallen into the habit of always having a few sitting spare at home.

“Did Zayn tell you I was here?” she asks him, and Harry is finally able to look away from her lips. He can’t help but note that she’s avoided responding to his confession and as hurt as he is, he knows that he can’t blame her for it.

“I had to force it out of him,” he nods at her. They’re still standing inches from each other and she still hasn’t pushed him away and Harry is taking that as a good sign.

“I doubt it would have taken much prodding.” She winces as the words come out a little sharper than she’d intended. “He’s never been very good at keeping secrets,” she adds.

“Especially when he thinks he’s right,” Harry joins in.

It’s awkward.

Neither of them know what to say and neither of them seem to be willing to pull away.

Harry’s still trying to take all of her in, trying to note any changes in the month they had spent apart. She’s thinner and looks more tired and nervous and her eyes don’t shine the way he’s always used to, but she still looks like Jazz and he still thinks she’s perfect.

Jazz can’t help taking him in either. She looks at him and sees her past and future all entwined together and she doesn’t know how to pull them apart.

She wants to be strong, wants to push him away and tell him that no, she doesn’t care that he misses her, that he should have remembered that before he had treated her so mean.

But she can’t.

She can’t because despite what he’s done, he’s still standing in front of her with his eyes once again honest and kind and all kinds of hurt and she wonders if maybe he sees the same in hers.

Zayn’s been telling her she needs to come home through texts she never answers, to forgive him at least a little bit because he’s not been doing very well. She hadn’t wanted to believe him at first, and she’d hated herself for hoping it was true for the longest time afterwards as well. Now as she looks up at him as he tells her he misses her, she sees that it was true and she doesn’t feel the satisfaction she thought she would have at the idea she wasn’t the only one suffering. She just feels sad.

She doesn’t know how they ended up here, two pieces of a broken puzzle that have no right fitting together anymore. But they do. They always will, she thinks.

“Why are you here, Harry?” she asks eventually, finally shifting away from him.

They both feel the loss instantly, a sudden chill running down both their spines.

Harry tucks his hands deep into his pockets, digging into the skin of his thighs to keep from reaching out for her again.

“I want you to come home,” he tells her without hesitation. He thinks it should be more said more eloquently as soon as the words are past his lips but it’s too late and as blunt as they may be, he’s spoken the truth. He just hopes that Jazz can see that.

He panics when he sees her look away from him. When she bites her lips and looks over his shoulder and out the door. He wonders if she’s thinking about the man who was in here before him and he feels the panic rise to his throat like bile as he imagines her with someone else.

“Please?” he forces out. “I love you.” And as he looks at her and sees the way her eyes widen a little and her shoulders drop at those words, he realises just how long it has been since he’s said them to her. So he repeats them and silently vows to himself to say them every chance he gets for as long as she’ll have him. Even if it is just for the next few minutes before she tells him she’s met someone else. “I love you.” He says again, firmer. “So please, come home.”

“I – I dunno if I can,” she confesses and she still won’t look at him and Harry feels like he can’t breathe. “There’s this space between us and I don’t know how to close it. I don’t know if we can.” She doesn’t really mean it when she says that, doesn’t want it to be true either. But she’s started to doubt their relationship, she’s started to doubt Harry and she thinks a part of her still wants to hurt him for that.

“Of course you can,” Harry says urgently, taking a step closer to her. She was too far away. Always too far. “You and me Jazz, we belong together, we always will. Together we can take over the whole damn world if we wanted to.”

And she believes him. She believes him because he’s Harry and she knows that a part of her – most of her – will always love him.

“Remember?” he steps closer to her, eyes flicking all over her face as he tries to read her. He hates that he’s finding it so difficult now. He’s never found it so difficult before. “You said you’d never give up on us.” And he knows he sounds accusatory, that she had every right to leave him. But he’s still hurt and he’s still in love with her and if he doesn’t tell her everything now he knows he’ll never forgive himself.

Jazz looks at him then, meets his gaze straight on and Harry’s finally able to read her again but he wishes he wasn’t, because when she looks at him now she looks nervous and afraid and unsure. Something she’s not been with him since she’d first introduced him to her family.

“Don’t. Don’t look at me like that please. Don’t look at me like it’s the first time we’ve met all over again.”

Jazz doesn’t say anything and he steels himself to having his heart broken. But when it doesn’t come and she continues to look at him still, he promises himself that he’ll do anything he can to make sure she never looks at him like that again.

Jazz sees the moment the resolve sets in his eyes like a curtain opening up to let the sun in and she thinks back to when they first met, when she’d told her family about him. She thinks about how her parents had been worried that she wouldn’t be able to handle being in a relationship with someone who was constantly in the spotlight and she remembers telling Harry as much.

He’d taken her face between his hands and kissed every inch of worry away with his lips and then promised that he’d change their mind. He’d had the same look in his eyes then that he does now and she knows without a doubt that he would’ve spent the rest of his life trying to make sure he kept his promise.

But he hadn’t needed to.

Her parents had loved him almost as much as she did, and even when she’d gone to them after the fight she’d had with Harry a month ago, they’d still urged her to go back and talk it through with him. ‘That boy would burn himself to the ground trying to bring you the sun if you asked him to’ her mum had told her.

“Jazz?” he calls out to her, and when she blinks she realises he’s looking at her worriedly. “Are you ok? Your eyes glazed over a little there. Have you been drinking enough water? Are you feeling ok?” His hands flutter by his sides before he gives in and reaches out to feel her head for a temperature.

He looks so worried about her that she can’t help it. She leans up and kisses him.

Harry’s entire body goes slack at the contact and wonders how he’s managed to be apart from her for so long without falling completely to pieces. When she pulls away from him, it’s too soon and he feels himself starting to unravel again but he just barely holds himself together. There were more important things to worry about right now.

“Does this mean you’ll come home?” he asks her, breathes on her, really. He hasn’t moved away and neither has she and their lips have barely separated from one another. He can feel whispers of her kiss with every word he utters as his lips skim along hers and their breath mingles together. With her so close, he feels as though he’s got a part of himself back.

“Yes,” she nods and Harry swears she moves even closer and his heart swells. “I’ve been miserable without you,” she confesses, whispers it across his lips like a secret only meant for him and he kisses her again. Harder, deeper and infinitely more desperate. There’s over a month of kisses he has to make up for.

A flash of blonde hair and Jazz laughing crosses his mind and he thinks of the man who was in here earlier, his hands on her arms and a fond smile on his lips and he wonders if maybe someone else had already been kissing her while he was waiting for her to come home.

He pulls away from her and instantly regrets it when Jazz tries to chase his lips. But his stomach has dropped and his mood has plummeted and he wonders if maybe they had been broken up this past month and not just giving each other space.

“I – that man,” he scratches at the back of his neck roughly. He doesn’t know what to say. How to say it. So he just speaks without thinking about the words flowing past his lips. “There was a man in here earlier,” he starts. “Who was he?” he thinks he sounds a little angry but he can’t help it. He’s nervous and jealous and the idea of another man putting his hands on his Jasmine makes Harry see red.

He wasn’t normally a jealous person. But Jazz was his.

“Man?” Jazz tilts her head, tries to move closer to him once more and looks hurt when he steps back again. “What man?”

Harry feels angry suddenly. He’d seen them standing together, much like he and Jazz were right now. Was she trying to lie to him? Did she think he’d leave her if he found out she’d moved on so quickly? Fat chance. Harry narrowed his eyes at the thought. He’d fight tooth and nail for her. take on the whole damn world and turn it to ashes to win her back.

“There was a man in here earlier, Jazz. I saw him standing exactly the way we are right now.”

“Oh!” she grins when she realises who he’s talking about. Body slumping with relief. “You mean Matt.”

Harry already hates him. Hates the way she smiles when she says his name. Hates that she ever said it in the first place. “I guess so. The one who was touching you too much.”

“Touching me?” she blinks at him and the confusion is back.

“Yes,” Harry nods vigorously. “He had his hand on your arm and you were laughing at something he’d said. If he’s a client it wasn’t very professional,” he adds, he sounds pouty and superior all at once and Jazz wants to hug him and kiss him and hit him all at once.

But then she realises what he’s saying and suddenly Jazz is laughing at him and Harry’s torn between watching her with awe and pulling his hair out because this was serious.

“Harry, are you jealous?” she asks him, once her laughter had turned to giggles and she once again took a step closer to him. This time he stays where he is.

“No.” Yes.

“No?” she quirks a brow. “So if I were to tell you I have plans this weekend to grab dinner with Matt, you’d be ok with that?”

Harry couldn’t stop the growl that escaped his lips if he tried and he doesn’t think he wants to. The very idea of Jazz with someone else has him seeing red and all he wants to do is grab hold of her and lock her away in a tower like Rapunzel with only each other for company. He really likes the idea of that.

“Fine, I’m a little jealous,” he admits, reaching out and entwining their hands together. “I don’t like the idea of you with someone else. But… I – I don’t blame you if you’ve found someone who treated you the way you deserved.” He forces the words past his lips and even tries to mean them but his heart still clenches at the thought and he thinks that it may very well stop if she agrees.

“Matt’s my cousin, you silly goose,” she bumps his shoulder fondly. “He’s in the city for the weekend and wanted to grab dinner before he left.”

“Oh.” Harry grins down at her sheepishly. “Can I come?”

Jazz lets out a loud, happy laugh and pulls him towards the door. “Come on, Harry, let’s go home.”

“I might never let you leave,” he warns her only half jokingly.

“I’ll hold you to that,” she warns him, her heart full once again. Harry pulls her to him and plants a kiss wherever his lips land and continues to do so every couple of steps on the way home – her lips, her hair, her nose, her cheeks – every inch of her face was covered in soft kisses and every kiss was followed by an ‘I love you’.

They don’t notice the flashes as pictures are taken and fans whisper about why the couple looks so happy together. And when Jazz shows him an article that Zayn had linked her with a series of question marks and a confused congratulations – the headline read that they were engaged – Harry laughs along with Jazz. He ignores the emails and phone calls his agent sends him about putting out a statement (there’s no point denying it when he’s already started ring shopping) and continues to spend the rest of the week couped up inside his flat with his girlfriend, mentally planning their future together.

blog.name: harrystyles-sweetestcreature
blog.title: Harry Styles Lover
blog.description:
Kelsey :) 23 Harry Styles has my heart.."We never learn, we've been here before." My Masterpieces!
Ask Me Anything!!

tags: last christmas i gave you my heart
summary: Last Christmas, I gave you my Heart
title: Last Christmas, I gave you my Heart
body:
*****ONE SHOT REQUEST!***Could you write about bff H being at YNs for Christmas and he’s not feeling so good so is being more cuddly than normal etc and he has no idea she loves him until he’s feeling a lot worse and is crying and she kisses his forehead? Like maybe he says something about wondering what her lips would taste like and she says he would find out if he wasn’t so blind? Like a cute couple ending please?*****

*********************************************


“Harryy!!” You screamed. “I’m so glad you came!”

You opened the door to let your best friend into the house. Looking at his face, you frowned. “Harry? What’s wrong? Are you feeling okay?”

“I’m fine, just a wee bit of a cold.” He pulled you into a warm hug.

“Are you sure?” You asked, not convinced. Putting your hand to his cheek and then his forehead, you could feel the warmth radiating from him.

“I’m sure!” He said brushing you off. “I’m not going to let a little cold ruin your family Christmas.”

“But..” You started to abject.

Putting his finger over your mouth, he shook his head. “No buts.”

“Fine! But you have to go sit down and relax.”

“Yes ma'am” He said sassy.

Rolling your eyes, you pushed him towards the living room. You picked up the presents he had left by the door and placed then under the tree. Harry made his way to the couch in the corner, and you brought him a blanket.

“So.. When is everyone suppose to be here?” He questioned, yawning.

“Should be any minute now. Can I get you anything?”

“I’m alright.” He mumbled closing his eyes.

“Are you sure? I could make you some soup, or I could get you some tea. I think I have some cold medicine here somewhere.”

Harry let out a slight chuckle. “I’m fine mum!”

You playfully smacked him. “I’m just trying to help.”

“I know, I know. Thanks, love.” He muttered settling deeper into the sofa.

You watched him fondly for a moment. It hurt you to see him sick, and all you wanted to do was make him feel better. You decided to let him rest. Going to the kitchen, you tried to busy yourself until your family arrived.  

You had just finished removing cookies from the oven, when you heard the doorbell ring. Rushing to answer it, you greeted your family.

“Y/n!” Your dad called out first, giving you a big hug.

“Hey y/n,” your step-mom came next. “It’s smells wonderful in here.”

“Thank you!” You told her giving her a brief hug.

Your brother and his wife were the next in line. Then came your sister and her new boyfriend. After greeting everyone, you led them to the living room. Harry was sound asleep in the corner.

“Oh hey! Harry’s here!” Trina cheered. Your sister was a huge fan of Harry’s and always stayed close by whenever he was around.

“Yes, but he’s not feeling well. So behave!” You told her sternly. She stuck her tongue out at you, causing you to laugh. “Real mature.”

“Are you ever gonna tell that boy you’re in love with him?” She asked curious.

“Trina!”

“What?” She said unashamed.

“Harry and I are just friends.”

“Yeah, yeah. Whatever you say.”

“Alright! Enough bickering you two.” Your dad called out.

“Why don’t we start eating?” You suggested.

Getting an agreement from everyone in the room, you motioned for them to head towards the dining room.

“What about Harry?” Trina asked disappointed.

“Harry needs to sleep. I’ll fix him a plate later.”

“Awe look at you all caring. Your so in love,” she teased.

“Oh hush!”

Your family gathered around the table and passed around the food. The conversation flowed nicely. Your family had always been one to make fun of one another. The laughter was nonstop, as the jokes flew back and forth.

You enjoyed having your family over. You had always been a big family person and found peace in the company you shared.

Once dinner was finished, and the dishes put away, you all headed back into the living room. It was getting late, and it was time to open presents.

Heading to where Harry still laid, you quietly put your hand on his forehead. His skin felt even hotter than it had before. Rushing back to the kitchen you got a glass of water and some medicine. Upon returning, you nudged Harry.

“Harry.” You shook him.

“Hmm?” He responded turning his head towards you, with his eyes still closed.

“Come on! Take this,” you urged him.

Mumbling some more he sat up on the couch and took the cup of water from you.

“What is it?” He asked looking at the pills questionably.

“It’s medicine! It’ll make you feel better.” He gave you a doubtful look. “Oh just take it, you big baby!”

Grunting he grabbed the pills from you and threw them into his mouth. “You aren’t trying to poison me are you?” He asked after swallowing his medicine.

“I guess we’ll find out,” you teased. “Do you feel well enough to open presents with us?”

He looked around, at the mention of ‘us’. Seeing your family, he looked a bit embarrassed.

“Y/n! Why didn’t you wake me when everyone got here?” He whispered to you.

“You needed your rest.” You stated simply.  

Shaking his head, he said a brief hello to each member of your family. Trina was ecstatic that he was finally up. She came to sit in between the two of you and started to bombard him with questions. Rolling your eyes, you gave Harry a look of pity. Deciding to save him, you tried to get her attention.

“Trina, how about we let Harry have a breather and open presents?” At the mention of this, Trina leaped up with joy. You stared after your 17 year old sister in disbelief.

“Thank you!” Harry spoke softly so only you could hear.

“Anytime,” you told him with a smile.

You remained by his side, as your dad started handing out presents. Harry leaned over and laid his head in your lap. You smiled down at him fondly, since he was looking away.

“How are you feeling?” You asked running your fingers through his hair.

“Awful,” he admitted finally.

“I’m sorry dear.” You told him worried.

“It’s alright, you make it all better. Will you stay with me?” He closed his eyes and relaxed a bit into your lap.

“Of course. I’m not going anywhere.” His skin felt as if it were on fire, and you desperately hoped the fever would soon break.  

Harry dosed in and out of consciousness, as you watched your family unwrap their gifts. This had always been your favorite time of the year. You loved having your family around. Along with Harry, they were your favorite people in the world. You just wished he felt better so he could enjoy it with you as well.

You kept noticing your mom glancing at the two of you. She had a smirk on her face, and you knew what she had been thinking instantly. Secretly, your entire family had been routing for the two of you to get together. You had to admit, you wanted the same.

You and Harry had been best friends for as long as you could remember. You couldn’t remember a time where he wasn’t a part of your life. He meant the world to you, and you wanted more than anything to be the one who made him the happiest.

You watched for years as he dated girls that did nothing but use him. They all seemed to be the same. They would date him long enough to be in the spotlight, and then leave him broken. It killed you that he fell for their lies and manipulation.

'If only he could see how much you truly loved him for him.’ You thought sadly.

It had gotten late, and your family were getting ready to leave. You started to get up, to tell them goodbye.

“Noo don’t go,” Harry whined half asleep. He grabbed your waist to keep you there.

Laughing slightly, you looked at him sadly. He would never know how much it hurt you when he done things like this. He always grew quite clingy when he was drunk or unwell. You loved clingy Harry, but deep down knew that it would never mean the same to him as it did to you.

“I’ll be right back, I promise.” You told him. He pouted further, but let you go.

You quickly told your family to drive carefully and lead them out the front. Your mom hung back briefly, as you watched the others head for the car.

She smiled at you, as she looked you over. “Oh just say it!”

“Honey,” she started. “I just hate seeing you like this. I don’t want you to get hurt. I know you care for him, but you just have to take care of yourself as well.”

“I know,” you whispered.

“You know I love you.”

“I know, I love you too mom.” Giving her one final hug, you watched her leave.

Sighing, you shut the door and returned to Harry. He was sound asleep once more. Checking his head, you sighed with relief. His temperature was finally starting to drop.

Checking the time, you left him to get some more medicine. You also made him a bowl of soup. You knew that your mom had been right, but you couldn’t help how you felt. You couldn’t imagine your life without Harry. If that meant you had to just be his friend, so be it.

Trying to clear your mind, you headed back to wake him. Setting his food on the end table, you went to wake him.

“Harryy,” you sung softly. “Time to wake up!”

He groaned, but didn’t budge. “Come on sleepy head! You need to take some more medicine and eat something.”

Groaning once more, he slowly sat up. He looked adorable, with his hair a mess and sleep in his eyes. Giving him the pills, he swallowed them without protest.

“Here,” you handed him the soup. “You need to eat something.” His hesitation caused you to roll your eyes. “Oh come on! I made your favorite, and you know I’m not gonna stop until you finish it.”

Sighing, he took the bowl. He knew it would be pointless to fight a losing battle. “You’re going to be the death of me.”

“You’re welcome!” You told him smiling. “I honestly don’t know what you would do without me!”

He gave you a shy smile. “I don’t either,” he muttered. He has spoken so quietly that you weren’t sure you had heard him correctly.

Finishing his soup in silence, you decided to turn on a Christmas movie. He sat aside his empty bowl and smirked at you. “Happy now?”

“Almost,” you told him smiling. “How are you feeling?”

“A bit better.” He laid down, once more putting his head in your lap. “Thank you for taking care of me.” He mumbled snuggling into you.

“What are friends for,” you told him sadly.

Sensing your mood shift, he glanced up at you. “What is it?” He asked concerned.

“It’s nothing,” you told him faking a smile.

“Even when I’m sick, I can still tell when your lying to me.”

“I’m not lying.” You told him sticking out your tongue.

“I know you didn’t just stick your tongue out at me,” he said with a wicked glint in his eyes.

“So what if I did?” You said challenging him.

Slowly he sat up, as he watched you. Without warning, he started to tickle your sides.

“Heyy!” You said protesting trying to fight him off.

“Say you’re sorry,” he said laughing.

“Never!” You said between giggles.

He continued in his torment. “I can do this all night,” he warned.

“Fine!” You said giving in. “I give up, but only because you’re sick! I’m sorry!”

He looked at you fondly. “And?” He prompted

“And.. Harry Styles is the most wonderful and sexy man of all time.” You told him automatically.

“And don’t you forget it,” he said with a smirk.

He was just inches from your face, causing your breath to catch in your throat. “You’re so beautiful,” he whispered.

Rolling your eyes, you looked away. This had not been the first time he had said those words, and your heart wanted so bad to believe him.

“I’m serious!” He said turning your head back so he could look at you. His face grew serious.

“Well thank you, H.” You leaned over and kissed his forehead gently.

His eyes slipped closed, and he gave you a shy smile. “You know I’ve always been curious about something.”

“What’s that?” You whispered. Your heart was pounding out of your chest, and you were sure that he could hear it.

“I’ve always wondered what it would be like to kiss you.” He confessed.

This took you off guard. He looked sincere, but you knew it was too good to be true. “That must be the fever talking.” You said laughing nervously.

“I’m serious!” He said hurt. “I’ve always had a thing for you, and I would never be able to forgive myself if I never told you how I felt.”

“Harry.. Please don’t.” You begged turning from him. Turning away, you felt tears prick your eyes.

“Y/n,” he whispered, trying to get your attention once more. Giving up, he dropped his hand. “I understand if you don’t feel the same.”

The silence lingered only briefly. Taking a deep breathe, you turned back to him. He looked hurt, as he took in the tears running down your face.

“Hey.. please don’t cry.” He begged wiping the tears from your cheek.

“Harry,” you said finally, grabbing his hand. You held it to your face, as you closed your eyes. “Harry..” You began again. “I love you.”

“I know,” he whispered, “and I love you.”

“No you don’t get it,” you told him shaking your head. You looked into his eyes with new determination. “Harry.. I’m in love with you. I have been since we first became friends all those years ago. I just never knew how to tell you. I didn’t want to risk losing you.” You confessed quietly.

You looked away, as you let him digest your words. The silence lingered. Your heart started to break, as you imagined the worst.

“You don’t have to say anything,” you whispered. “We can just forget this entire night, if you want.”

The silence was maddening. You finally made yourself look at him. Glancing towards him, you froze. He had the most breathtaking smile gracing his face. You looked at him confused.

“What is..” you began, but you were cut off.

Harry leaned in silencing you with a kiss. His lips were warm against yours, as he kissed you passionately. You melted into him, as you kissed him back with just as much passion. Pulling away, he placed his forehead to yours. Trying to catch your breath, you closed your eyes.

He began to chuckle. “What is it?” You asked amused.

“I’ve been in love with you ever since the day I first laid eyes on you.” He confessed.

“Wait what??”

“It’s true,” he shrugged.

“Then why haven’t you ever said anything!” You said incredibility.

“I never thought I deserved someone as amazing as you are.” He said sincerely.

“Harry,” you said with a shake of your head. “You deserve so much more. You deserve the entire universe and so much more.”

“Can I officially call you mine now?” He asked hopeful.

“I might be okay with that,” you teased.

“Oh you might?” He said raising his brow. He started tickling your side again. It was hard to put up a fight, when he had you in his lap. “I was kidding!” You yelled.

Putting your hand on either side of his face, you brought your lips to his. “I would love nothing more than to be yours.”

His answering smile was heart warming, as he crushed you into his chest. “Now you really need to be resting, my love. Your still burning up.”

“Still as bossy as ever.” He chuckled.

“That, my dear will never change! Now come!” You told him raising to your feet.

Leading him to your room, you made him lay down. Turning off the lights, you joined him in the soft bed. You cuddled into his chest and relaxed immediately.

“I could definitely get used to this,” he hummed contently, pulling you closer.  

You smiled into his chest, as you drifted off into a peaceful slumber.
